intro: Struthanthus pyrifolius, commonly known as the fireleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, waxy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often succulent and branched. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
